title: Suggest adding `&` for "mismatched types: expected reference `&&[&str]`, found reference `&[&str]`"

labels.name: C-enhancement
labels.description: Category: An issue proposing an enhancement or a PR with one.

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: A-suggestion-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: suggestions generated by the compiler applied by cargo fix

body:
This code can be easily fixed by adding an `&` in the call to `contains`.

```rust
fn main() {
    let haystack = [&["A1", "A2"][..], &["B1", "B2"], &["C1", "C2"]];
    let needle: &[&str] = &["D1", "D2"];
    println!("{}", haystack.contains(needle));
}

```

([Playground](https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=stable&mode=debug&edition=2018&gist=849bed705c38f0d4ac2c3f0284fd8695))

Errors:

```
   Compiling playground v0.0.1 (/playground)
error[E0308]: mismatched types
 --> src/main.rs:4:38
  |
4 |     println!("{}", haystack.contains(needle));
  |                                      ^^^^^^ expected `&[&str]`, found slice `[&str]`
  |
  = note: expected reference `&&[&str]`
             found reference `&[&str]`

error: aborting due to previous error

For more information about this error, try `rustc --explain E0308`.
error: could not compile `playground`.

To learn more, run the command again with --verbose.

```
